title: Patch Chat with the Playtest Team - 7.18
body:
https://news-a.akamaihd.net/public/na_images/PCHCHT/Minions.jpg
Header by inkiness

Hey, everyone! I'm Riot King Cobra and it's time for another round of Patch Chat! These threads serve as opportunity for us to talk about the patches that come out every two weeks. You can find the most recent patch by following this link: [Patch 7.18 Notes](http://na.leagueoflegends.com/en/news/game-updates/patch/patch-718-notes).

I'm on Riot's Playtest Team, a group of high elo players who play with the new champions, reworks, balance tweaks, items, and map updates before they are released. It's our job to the test the changes that our designers come up with and ensure that we're introducing positive changes to League in terms of both balance and fun. Ask us questions - we'll try to answer as many as we can!

7.18 is the last patch to go out before Worlds 2017, and as such, mainly focuses on bringing in some dominant professional picks and lightly buffing some champions in hopes they can find some play. Please, ask us questions about the patch or our jobs in general! We'd love to talk to you guys as fellow LoL players. :)

Don “Aesah” Ding
Dan “penguin” Hardison
Robert “ROBERTxLEE” Lee
Rob "King Cobra" Rosa
Trevor “ThEntropist” Thernes
Arnor "Hjarta" Halldorsson
Brian "Madness Heroo" Pressoir
Christy "Ender L" Frierson
Chris "Auberaun" Roberts
Nick "Endstep" Frijia
Nabi "Novalas" Barak
Sigmundur "GangIeri" Helgason

replies.body: Ha, thanks for all the confirmations I hope to see him at worlds, but I highly doubt it. P.S (If you wanted to drop some hints on the upcoming eve rework your secrets will be safe with me.

> [{quoted}](name=Riot ThEntropist,realm=NA,application-id=A7LBtoKc,discussion-id=qx3Zh25H,comment-id=000d0000,timestamp=2017-09-13T20:22:38.513+0000)
>
> ( .  Y . )

Now, this is the kind of sneak peek I can get behind! 

{{sticker:sg-miss-fortune}}
I'm the main playtester for Evelynn. Can't talk too much about her but I find her super fun~

Can you say whether the rework is accessible to average players? For example, I used to do quite well with Kat and LB, but their reworks made them too difficult for me to consistently play well. Is that happening with Eve, or is going to be as accessible as Talon or WW reworks?
Our perception is that she is a little bit more difficult than live but still very accessible to the average player.

Is she getting any explosive mobility abilities? (Like LB's W or Zed's W)
Or at least some sort of mobility?
She is spicy for sure
When will this world cease to exist?

Well, current estimates have a pretty generous timeframe - sometime around 2 to 3 billion years from now, the sun will expand (and get more luminous) and Earth will be too hot to sustain liquid water. Maybe at that point we'll have figured out how to live in a world that hot, but maybe not. I'd say either way the world will cease to exist at that point, at least as we know it right now. Earth would be a pretty different place with no oceans.
bruh
December 21st, 2012.

As a Zac main, I'm concerned about the time you run out of colors for his chromas and skins (since, you know, he is basically one-colored), what are you going to do then? Is Icecream Zac ever gonna be a thing? {{item:3681}} {{champion:154}} {{item:3681}}
I think we just shift to colors that are outside the visible spectrum and humans can't perceive.  This way, Faker will have a reason to buy them
Then we start doing multiple colors... and THEN RAINBOW ZAC! (sherbert zac?)
He needs a suit.
When will that fizz rework or revert drop? {{sticker:sg-lulu}}
Nothing planned right now.  Got any ideas?

No specific ideas, but more dps to make him not feel like an ult-oneshot bot, more reliability and skill expression would be fun.
It would be ok for other champs but when I play the "Tidal Trickster" Id like to have a bit more tricks and combos to learn than "hit R - use all buttons without dodging anything with E because its also your main damage tool" (since you max it first).

I think one of the main things I learned after working on Fizz is the importance of having several different combos you can do on assassins. If he ever comes up again I will probably stress this as a big point. Him feeling very binary makes him easier to play against however, it means he does not feel very smart or tricky which takes away from the fantasy. 

I would love to work with a designer on him again, but currently I doubt we will take anything major up soon.

Maybe this is a silly or even presumptuous question, but is there anything that mains of a champ like Fizz can do to get their voices heard in terms of advocating for changes?

I think you've caught on to a reason a lot of Fizz mains were deeply unsatisfied with the rework, even almost 1 year out, but it's really disappointing to hear that there's no plans to fix the problems it caused. I know there are higher priorities to work on, especially when leading up to worlds, but it sucks when the champ you play is in a bad state and in the "will never revisit" bin just because they have a 50% winrate and aren't a problem child at the moment.

To be honest, I agree with you. I was a big Fizz player (well most assassins) and I really don't play him anymore (or most of the assassins in the rework) because I flat out feel we made the class less fun. We were so caught up on making them fair to play against that we broke the thing that made them... them. My hope is that one day we will revisit it, but a lot of people are happy with the state of assassins(mainly playing against wins) so I do not see it happening on the horizon. 

As for getting your voice heard, bringing up arguments on threads is usually your best bet. Things like Meddler's daily thoughts would be a good place to start. Sorry I can't be more helpful here.

>because I flat out feel we made the class less fun.

That's a far too common outcome of class reworks in general. The tank rework made tanks less fun and generally cancerous too. This is a large part of the reason why the class reworks, and especially the tank, assassin and mage reworks were such colossal failures. I just hope Riot can accept how badly the fucked up with class reworks and start working to unfuck it, through reverts and further reworks on the worst champions, IMO {{champion:143}} {{champion:134}} {{champion:84}} {{champion:105}} {{champion:7}} {{champion:107}} {{champion:113}} {{champion:154}} and {{champion:57}} .

For {{champion:143}} {{champion:84}} {{champion:105}} {{champion:7}} {{champion:107}} and {{champion:57}} I think they need further work.

{{champion:113}} {{champion:154}} and {{champion:134}} should just be reverted, their reworks only made them worse.
I strongly disagree on Akali and Sejuani. Those champions became much more interesting to play after their reworks.

I'm just going to argue on Sejuani since Riot's already confirmed that Akali is scheduled for a rework anyway, you can find their reasoning on that if you want to know why.

As for Sej, no the rework did not make her more interesting, it made her the same as every other tank. Sej as with recent tanks is basically a braindead CC bot. She lost all the unique things she had going for her before the rework being a tank/bruiser hybrid in favour of being forced into being Gragas 2.0.

This is all before mentioning that Sej is pure cancer to play against and less fun to play as. Everything about the Sejuani rework was an utter failure. It is the clearest cut case of any rework where a reversion is obviously the best solution.

There was literally nothing unique or interesting about the old Sejuani, that's why she was one of the least-played champions in the game for years. I've seen the surveys, most players really liked the Sejuani rework and virtually nobody wants it reverted.

>There was literally nothing unique or interesting about the old Sejuani

She was a hybrid bruiser/tank, that was unique. What she is now is Gragas 2.0. Same goes for Zac, Maokai, Galio and Poppy. All of these champs are essentially the exact same since their reworks. This is why I'd say the tank rework was such an abysmal failure, it homogenised the entire class. 

>that's why she was one of the least-played champions in the game for years.

https://www.leagueofgraphs.com/champions/stats/sejuani

She had a pickrate of about 3-4%, that's far from "one of the least picked". She wasn't as popular as Lee Sin, sure but not every champ has to be. She was still more popular than a champ like Kled, who I don't think anyone will argue is problematic because of his low pickrate. It's also worth noting that for this duration the only popular jungle tank was Gragas because the entire meta conspired against jungle tanks.

>I've seen the surveys, most players really liked the Sejuani rework and virtually nobody wants it reverted.

I'd like a link to that survey, because despite being one of the most well read people on the boards on this topic I've never seen it.

Also if it was taken one week after the rework it means nothing. People also thought the Kog rework was great one week after the rework. Those who aren't dedicated mains needed time to find out just how cancerous both are.

Hm.. unfortunate. Is E cooldown reduction (at max rank this time) back to 8 still not an option either, maybe along with nerfs to other stuff that isnt E damage (at least not to minions because he needs wave clear)?
Because I feel like that alone could give him some more options and room to make plays until then.


Also one more question: Do you guys think Fizz is fine design and/or balance wise atm?
I doubt a substantial E buff will ever get through in it's current state. There are a lot of concerns around the frustration around that ability.
why did you monsters remove azirs ult not blocking dashes, yet not increase the duration on it AND lower the travel speed of his e

cuz we added other stufs to comepsnate

In actuality though it's about opening him up to be dove on (giving him a weakness) while also giving him power back to allow him to hopefully have a clearer play pattern.
if thats the reason then why not revert the ult duration nerf from 6.11 since now it has a clear weakness and it just on its own separate from his kit is lack luster for using it defensively now

I thought the intended weakness this rework was supposed to give him was being closer to the fight so people can actually attempt to hit him with abilities?  And also with that shorter range, he is more vulnerable to be dove upon.  Could you elaborate more (preferably without a meme answer)?
Allowing people to jump through his ult hits on the goal of getting people more within his range. Is there a reason that it feels too far or makes him too vulnerable with his added effects?
Why no pool-party skins?

Lag


...Actually, we have very limited visibility into the skin decision making processes
can we expect new poolparty skins this year? ^^
They literally just said...
Kind of off-topic as it doesn't directly relate to the patch, but is Urgot enabled for worlds?
Yes (I have successfully blended in with the playtesters)
Since no one seems to be answering this comment, I'll step in. Urgot is enabled for worlds.
How does it feel to get memed by Riot staff?
Last I checked yes
Unsure if this was answered yet or not, but yes. :^)
hm yes I think so
should be, yeah
Yep.
For those of you who play support, does the Spell Theif's Edge line feel competitive to you at this time?

It's certainly stronger now (CDR is kewl and enables early aggression), but because of the meta largely being rush to Ardent Censer (coin gives more gold) plus coin giving a lot of mana sustain, it might still be outshone. Tank supports are also pretty favored and in a strong place at the moment. So I think it's a good change but I might still prefer coin or relic shield on many supports.
Did any playtester believe that 20% CDR on Eye of the Watchers was overpowered? What were the problem cases with FQC migrating to mid lane?
